thread.title: H.S. football roundup: Seth Scalvino’s touchdown dash lifts Hasbrouck Heights over Cresskill
thread.title_full: H.S. football roundup: Seth Scalvino’s touchdown dash lifts Hasbrouck Heights over Cresskill

title: H.S. football roundup: Seth Scalvino’s touchdown dash lifts Hasbrouck Heights over Cresskill
text:
Pages: 1 2 > display on one page 
Seth Scalvino’s 73-yard touchdown run with 4:30 remaining put Hasbrouck Heights ahead and the Aviators’ defense had two goal-line stands in the fourth quarter of a 21-14 victory over Cresskill in an NJIC Meadowlands Division football game at Hasbrouck Heights on Friday night. 
Scalvino had 111 yards on 14 carries. Sean O’Malley had 11 tackles and Scott Salerno added eight tackles and a sack for the Aviators (6-1). 
Brendan Coffey had a 2-yard TD rush and a two-point conversion for the Cougars (4-3). 
WEEHAWKEN 20, SECAUCUS 19 (at Secaucus) — Joan Andujar had 228 yards and three touchdowns on a school-record 42 carries, and his two-point conversion run proved to be the difference for the Indians (5-2). 
Evander Pons scored on TD rushes of 36 and 5 yards for the Patriots. 
WALDWICK/MIDLAND PARK 33, MANCHESTER 32 (at Waldwick) — Garrett King’s 60-yard touchdown run with three minutes remaining rallied the Warriors (5-2). 
PALISADES PARK/LEONIA 42, LODI 35 (at Palisades Park) — JoJo Robinson carried 25 times for 206 yards and four touchdowns, and went 6-of-11 for 82 yards to lift the Tigers (3-4). The Rams’ (1-6) Steven Villa threw a 12-yard TD pass, scored on a 15-yard run and returned a kickoff 90 yards for touchdown. 
GLEN ROCK 33, HARRISON 13 (at Harrison) — Matt Schlett ran for touchdowns of 2, 1 and 5 yards, and had TD passes of 25 and 3 yards to carry the Panthers (6-1). 
WALLINGTON 40, EMERSON 20 (at Emerson) — Tyshaun Horton had touchdown rushes of 1, 3, 13 and 15 yards and returned the second-half kickoff 75 yards for a score to power the Panthers (3-5). 
BIG NORTH 
PASSAIC TECH 19, CLIFTON 7 (at Clifton) — Kevin Copper had 112 yards and a touchdown on 19 rushes to lead the Bulldogs (6-1) over the Mustangs (3-2-1CQ) for their sixth straight Liberty Division title. 
WAYNE HILLS 28, PARAMUS 7 (at Paramus) — Luca Grave ran for 106 yards and two touchdowns on 14 carries, and added two interceptions to guide the Patriots (6-2) by the Spartans (3-4). Derek De La Cruz had 30 carries for 110 yards and a TD for Paramus. 
NV/OLD TAPPAN 44, NORTHERN HIGHLANDS 21 (at Old Tappan) — Zach DeNike carried 16 times for 110 yards and three touchdowns, and Jordan Fuller caught six passes for 198 yards and a score to lift the Golden Knights (7-0). Kevin Martinez was 11-of-16 for 277 yards and two TDs, and John Piccinich and Dillon Policastro combined for 17 tackles and four sacks. 
Gavin Quarto returned an interception 86 yards for a score and caught a 33-yard touchdown pass from Noah Abdalla (two TDs) for the Highlanders (2-5). 
INDIAN HILLS 49, TENAFLY 10 (at Oakland) — Tim O’Brien was 12-of-17 for 232 yards and five TDs to power the Braves (5-2) over the Tigers (2-5) and snap a two-game losing streak. Nick Wisnovsky caught six passes for 135 yards and three TDs, and Matt Wisnovsky had 11 tackles and an interception for the Indian Hills. 
MAHWAH 49, PASCACK HILLS 0 (at Mahwah) — James Ciliento rushed for touchdowns of 7 and 10 yards, threw a 45-yard TD pass and returned a punt 70 yards for a score as the Thunderbirds (7-0) rolled. 
NJAC 
PEQUANNOCK 28, NEWTON 7 (at Newton) — Tommy Crooks had touchdown rushes of 22, 15 and 9 yards, and Sean Klimek added a 27-yard TD run to lift the Golden Panthers (6-1) over the Braves (3-4). 
KINNELON 52, WHIPPANY PARK 27 (at Kinnelon) — Jon Toye was 15-of-25 for 389 yards and six touchdowns to power the Colts (1-6). 
NON-CONFERENCE 
LYNDHURST 47, IMMACULATE CONCEPTION 7 (at Lyndhurst) — Matthew DeMarco (15 and 49 yards) and Peter Guerriero (47, 42) each ran for two touchdowns to lead the Golden Bears (3-4) over the Lions (1-6). Guerriero finished with 181 yards on five attempts in less than one half. 
IMG ACADEMY 28, PARAMUS CATHOLIC 20 (at Bradenton, Fla.) — Buoyed by big plays, IMG Academy (7-0) made it 3-for-3 over Big North United teams. 
After giving up a touchdown on the Ascenders’ first offensive play, the Paladins (3-4) rallied with Ahmad Thomas capping a 16-play drive on a 1-yard plunge. After an interception by Hajee Lopez, Alijah Jackson scored on a 21-yard run to give the Paladins a 13-7 lead. 
But the Ascenders had too much. Senior running back (and Notre Dame commitment) Tony Jones Jr. ran for a 1-yard score just before halftime, then broke loose on a 59-yard run for a third-quarter score. 
Down eight, PC got the ball back with 1:43 to play, but couldn’t put together a drive. © 2015 North Jersey Media Group Tags:
